page.title: 07GROWTH OF CROSSGATES 1
page.content: { {Crossgates}grew up mainly due to mining industry in the area. It is sited at the junction of the old{ {Dunfermline}to{Kircaldy},and{Perth}to{ {Edinburgh}roads.The name{Crossgates means{"cross roads"}in old Scots. The village grew quite rapidly between{1841}and{1891}.Most of its inhabitants were colliers. In{1896} the population was recorded as{1165,} now it is{1636}. Although in recent years the village has grown in size with two new private housing schemes, the population has increased little. Around Crossgates the land is fertile and is used mainly as arable farmland employing few people from the village. The coal mines have now all closed down, but signs of shafts can still be seen around the area.
